design_system.name: Emerald Horizon
design_system.philosophy: Structured, Floating, Data-First. Moving away from generic glassmorphism to distinct, card-based layouts.

sidebar.desktop_behavior: Floating panel with 16px margin from edges, rounded-2xl corners. Detached from header.

header.layout: Flex row, detached from sidebar on desktop.

elements.user_profile: Compact pill with avatar and name. No gradients.

cards.style: Flat surface, subtle 1px border, no heavy shadows. Focus on typography.

implementation_steps.instructions: Replace the entire CSS with the new 'Emerald Horizon' system. Key changes: Remove global glassmorphism. Add .sidebar-floating class. Update root variables for cleaner, flatter colors. Ensure .sidebar has 'position: fixed; top: 1rem; bottom: 1rem; left: 1rem; border-radius: 1rem;' for the floating effect on desktop.

Refactor the layout structure. 1. Wrap the Sidebar in a container that allows it to float on desktop. 2. Update the Header to be 'sticky top-0' but respect the sidebar's space. 3. Ensure the 'main' content area has appropriate padding-left to account for the floating sidebar (approx 300px). 4. Update NavLink classes to match the new 'pill' style defined in CSS.
Ensure 'emerald' color palette is available. (It usually is by default in Tailwind, but check if it needs to be explicitly added to 'extend').

do_not: Do not use heavy gradients for backgrounds.
Do not use 'Inter' font for headings.
Do not make the sidebar full-height on desktop (keep it floating).
must_do: Ensure high contrast for text (WCAG AA).
